newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Iran says oil production capacity over 4 mln bpd.
newsitem.headline: Iran says oil production capacity over 4 mln bpd.

text.p: Iran's oil minister Gholamreza Aghazadeh said on Sunday the country's crude oil production capacity has exceeded four million barrels per day (bpd), the official Iranian news agency IRNA reported.
It quoted him as saying production of crude oil from offshore oil fields is expected to exceed 500,000 bpd by the end of the current Iranian year in March 1997.
He added that average onshore oil production has reached 3.5 million bpd.
Iran exports $500 million worth of chemical and petrochemical products each year, he added.

The Islamic republic exported $14.94 billion in crude oil in 1995. Oil revenues in the first four months of the current Iranian year which began in March were 10 percent higher than those in the same period in 1995, the minister said.
